data.text: The IMF is fully committed to supporting its member countries during the #COVID19 outbreak. Learn more about the IMF's work to address this global challenge here: https://t.co/MmAtAVRwus https://t.co/h5nwDCTtYA

Growth in the #advancedeconomies group is projected at –5.8% in 2020, 2.3 percentage points stronger than in the June 2020 WEO Update reflecting better-than-foreseen #US and #euroarea GDP growth. Read more in the #WEO https://t.co/XMCO1emJHw https://t.co/vLotScKGxo

For #emergingmarket and developing economies, growth is forecast at –3.3% in 2020, 0.2 percentage point weaker than in the June 2020 WEO Update, strengthening to 6% in 2021. Read the latest #WEO. https://t.co/XMCO1emJHw https://t.co/92YlRF9nKD

▶️ TUNE IN tomorrow, Oct. 20, 9:00am for a discussion on which groups have been more affected by #lockdowns, with IMF Chief Economist @GitaGopinath,  @VodafoneGroup @Joakim_Reiter, and  @CNBCi's @Silvia_Amaro #WEO #COVID19 https://t.co/JL7Z8i9AnX
📊 NEW: See the latest global, regional, and country projections in the October issue of the World Economic Outlook #WEO. https://t.co/ZpkEgqFQHK https://t.co/OcQH1thrqz

Int'l cooperation is essential to ensure #CrossBorderPayments advances are good for all countries & different uses; allow different systems to work together; unite multiple public & private actors; and manage the impact on countries. Read @KGeorgieva blog https://t.co/j9jO07rWEX
Stay tuned as the IMF conference continues with three more panels on the future of #CrossBorderPayments streaming here: https://t.co/9OuqCKXbJQ https://t.co/02K5f9yihB

LIVE: @KGeorgieva discusses global cooperation on central bank digital currencies and #CrossBorderPayments with @federalreserve’s Jerome Powell, @SAMA_GOV's Ahmed Alkholifey, @BNM_official’s Nor Shamsiah Yunus and @BIS_org's Agustín Carstens. https://t.co/R1HhUYJtaU
Live with @KGeorgieva: A conversation on Cross-Border Payments—A Vision for the Future: https://t.co/I38pquq430 #CrossBorderPayments #IMFmeetings https://t.co/R1HhUYJtaU

Countries in the #MiddleEast & #CentralAsia responded swiftly to the COVID-19 pandemic, from increasing health spending to cutting taxes, which helped avoid worse outcomes. However, these measures, with the sharp drops in revenues, create fiscal challenges https://t.co/otIlWBqzmQ https://t.co/6GsDO0i0Rs

LIVE: @KGeorgieva discusses global cooperation on central bank digital currencies and #CrossBorderPayments with @federalreserve’s Jerome Powell, @SAMA_GOV's Ahmed Alkholifey, @BNM_official’s Nor Shamsiah Yunus and @BIS_org's Agustín Carstens. https://t.co/R1HhUYJtaU
LIVE: A conversation on Cross-Border Payments—A Vision for the Future: https://t.co/I38pquq430 #CrossBorderPayments #IMFmeetings https://t.co/R1HhUYJtaU

#Oil exporters in the #MiddleEast and #NorthAfrica have been hit the hardest by the economic crisis, given the double-whammy of lockdowns and the sharp decline in oil demand and prices, as well as production cuts, following OPEC+ agreements. https://t.co/otIlWBqzmQ https://t.co/uwy5v67ETo
Countries in the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia can build a stronger, greener, and more inclusive future. Read our #IMFBlog https://t.co/jYp4r3wkpb

How can countries in the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia build a resilient economic recovery? Find out at #IMFBlog 
 https://t.co/jYp4r3wkpb https://t.co/FSdzMyyFyF

Real GDP for the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia is projected to fall by 4.1 percent in 2020 as the COVID-19 crisis continues, with MENAP oil exporters contracting by -6.6 percent, MENAP oil importers by -1 percent, and CCA countries by  2.1 percent. https://t.co/otIlWBqzmQ https://t.co/oabZUkZQVy

The #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia region’s large exposure to the hard-hit services sector, particularly #tourism, could have a significant impact on GDP and #employment, with lingering effects for the next 2-5 years.  https://t.co/otIlWBqzmQ https://t.co/JNut3KgKwO
Watch Now the Virtual Regional Economic Outlook for the #MiddleEast and #CentralAsia with Jihad Azour.  Read Report https://t.co/E6J9R4acqO #IMFmeetings https://t.co/n67WZZ3FBi
LIVE: Press briefing on the latest Regional Economic Outlook for the Middle East and Central Asia. https://t.co/E6J9R4acqO #IMFmeetings https://t.co/15ZULcjwP9

Our latest #FiscalMonitor examines how governments are managing the crisis, and discusses what they can do to save lives, mitigate the impact of the recession, and revive growth and job creation. https://t.co/ZooX4vmsac #IMFmeetings https://t.co/cBSmi0ShmR

.@KGeorgieva: The global economy is coming back from the depths of the crisis, but it faces what I call a “Long Ascent’—a difficult climb that will be long, uneven, and uncertain. And prone to setbacks. https://t.co/xGvbjZozwk #IMFmeetings #LSE125 https://t.co/8jPUiTmVkg

In the latest issue of the World Economic Outlook, IMF Chief Economist Gita Gopinath says the recession will continue in 2020 with global growth projected at -4.4% and a partial rebound to 5.2% growth in 2021. Read the #WEO report. https://t.co/XMCO1emJHw https://t.co/Uf1HEDkudt

The #COVID19 crisis will deal a severe blow to global output compared to pre-pandemic projections, holding back living standard improvements across all countries, the latest IMF World Economic Outlook shows. #IMFBlog https://t.co/ZpkEgqFQHK https://t.co/ZSIC6Vcqe3

The global economy is recovering from the #COVID19 pandemic but the long ascent back to growth is uneven and uncertain. Find out more in our latest World Economic Outlook #WEO https://t.co/XMCO1emJHw https://t.co/O5pcjGWRGt

.@KGeorgieva at @WorldBank’s Development Committee: low-income economies need int'l support to maintain critical spending during the pandemic. The IMF will continue to help w/ lending, advice, debt relief & capacity development. Read her statement:  https://t.co/dVpIMRYU8H https://t.co/jd24itUhAV

The UN’s World Food Programme, recipient of the 2020 Nobel Peace Prize, projects that 270 million people will go hungry in countries where it operates before the end of the year, 82% more than before the pandemic. Learn more in F&D magazine: https://t.co/pgqUUgHP4u #WorldFoodDay https://t.co/hvOwnB2ibw

How can we #BuildForwardBetter? During our #IMFmeetings seminar, @KGeorgieva made 3 recommendations to policymakers:
✔️Improve health systems
✔️Avoid withdrawing stimulus support prematurely
✔️Orient stimulus towards transformation of the economy

This morning IMF’s Vitor Gaspar commended policymakers for their swift and decisive response to #COVID19, and urged countries not to withdraw fiscal support too rapidly. Public investment is key. #FiscalMonitor https://t.co/ZooX4v4RiE https://t.co/4fZNPmREUU

Fiscal policy needs a strategy to adapt to the unprecedented challenge from #COVID19, tailored to the phase of the pandemic. Our new #FiscalMonitor shares the details. https://t.co/z0T4he5rVv https://t.co/uUa1Ppc1WM

Before #COVID19 struck, debt was already elevated. With the unprecedented fiscal response to the crisis, global public debt has been pushed to an all-time high of close to 100% of GDP. More on our #IMFblog. #FiscalMonitor
https://t.co/1mGsD3aFiB https://t.co/BKdHEwQUX6
